item.description:
We are adding a fifth adventure-style relay race to the random calendar - the 2nd Annual Up, Down, & Around Challenge at Wachusett Mountain in Princeton, MA. This four-segment race involves a run, a bike, a climb, and a run down from the summit (which has replaced the ski leg due to the lack of snow and warm weather).

Do it solo or build a team!

=====

Segment 1 ... 5 mile Run: Start in the Wachusett Parking Lot, travel down the hill into Lot #3 and exit out on to Route 140. Then run along private dirt roads and a lakeside community, where it crosses the lake via a bridge before returning to paved roads and back up the entrance road to Wachustt.

Segment 2 ... 8 mile Bike: Get a good view of Princeton and Westminster in this scenic ride on a mostly paved, but partially dirt, road (~ 1 mile section). You choose what type of bike you want to use.

Segment 3 ... Climb*: How you get to the summit is up to you … hike, snowshoe, skin … just get there as fast as you can, and enjoy the views along the way.

Segment 4 ... Run Down from the summit:  Due to the lack of snow and the warmer temperatures, we have had to replace the SKI DOWN leg with a RUN DOWN. This will be a fun run on paved, gravel and dirt surfaces and an easy hiking trail. Great views along the way!!

  • 9:00AM -10:30 AM Registration
  • 11:00 AM Race Start: Individual Racers
  • 11:15 AM Race Start: Teams & Families
  • 2:00 PM Post-race Party & Awards

=====

Registration Fees

  • Mountain Man/Woman: $50 per person ($60 Race Day)
    (Individual participant completing all 4 legs of the race independently) 
  • Family or Open Team: $100 per team ($140 Race Day)
    (2 to 4 members teams with each member taking responsibility for 1-3 legs)

The entry fee includes: race entry, gift bag, tech wicking t-shirt, post-race snacks & party, and race support.

There will be no refunds.

=====

While you can use this page to communicate with others that are interested in participating in this event you need to visit the office race page to register.

Click here to register for the Up, Down, & Around Challenge.

=====

Here is more information about some of the other races that are on our calendar.

The Great Race, the Josh Billings, and Tully Lake are all three-segment team relay races - they have a paddle (lake kayak), peddle (road bike), and plod (road run) while the Greenway Challenge strings together 6 - 10 segments that include river/lake paddles, road/mountain peddles, or a road/trail plods.

  • The Great Race XXXV on August 12, 2012 in Auburn, NY. This will be our second year competing in this race. We will be competing in the traditional kayak race that consists of a 6.2 mile road run, a 19.5 mile road bike, and a 4.0 mile lake paddle. Click for more information about the great race.
  • The 36th Josh Billings RunAground on September 16, 2012 in Lenox, MA. This will be our fourth year competing in this race. We will be competing in the kayak race that consists of a 27.0 mile road bike, a 5.0 mile lake paddle, and a 6.2 mile run. Click for more information about the josh billings.
  • The 12th Blackstone River Valley Greenway Challenge on September 29, 2012 between Worcester, MA and Lincoln, RI. This will be our sixth year competing in this race. While the course (segments, distances, and route) won't be announced until next year (it changes every year), the 2011 course covered about 56 miles and had eight different segments: 5.5 mile run, 2.6 mile river kayak, 19.5 mile road bike, 6.0 mile run, 2.6 mile river kayak, 14.0 mile road bike, 3.1 mile trail run, and a 2.9 mile lake kayak. Click for more information about the greenway challenge.
  • The 6th Tully Lake Triathlon on October 13, 2012 in Royalston, MA. This will be our first year competing in this race. The race consists of a 5.0 mile lake paddle, a 4.5 mile trail run, and a 7.5 mile off-road bike. Click for more information about the tully lake.

Let me know if I can answer any questions or help you put a team together. If you would like to be part of a team indicate in your RSVP what part of the race you would like to do and maybe we can piece together a team or two.
item.name: The 2nd Annual Up, Down, & Around Challenge at Wachusett Mountain
